snippet: The Pew Research Center found that from 2009 to 2014, about a million Mexicans returned home as 870,000 arrived in the United States, marking an end to a wave of immigration.
abstract: Pew Research Center report reveals larger numbers of immigrants from Mexico are leaving United States are entering country, signal of end of largest influx of immigrants from single country in US history; decline is largely to due to drop in number of Mexican immigrants crossing into country illegally under stepped-up border security measures from Obama administration, but 2008 economic downturn played part.
lead_paragraph: The Pew Research Center found that from 2009 to 2014, about a million Mexicans returned home as 870,000 arrived in the United States, marking an end to a wave of immigration.

headline.main: More Mexican Immigrants Leaving U.S. Than Entering, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: More Mexicans Leaving the U.S. Than Coming In, a Study Finds
